message:
Hi Steve

I'm talking in the lines of WP8/WinRT based applications  
In I/O bound await mechanism, If I have a case like  
there are 4 operations and 4 are independent of the execution and so i want it to run in parallel in realtime.  
Consider this as 2 upload operations and 2 Fetch operations. All are async from the bottom.   
So the real point how to execute in parallel. The await mode of execution always waits for the first to complete.  
So this causes the second await to be queued. How can we run both of them same time?  
Does this means that the scheduling of these task on the Task scheduler and based on the availablity of thread it may or maynot run in parallel?   
If this is the case then there is very less change of parallelism in I/o bound operations?

Secondly When we run the Task.Run code if we are unable to cancel the task in the realtime then it really creates a over head of executing unwanted code?  
Regards
